title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message:
Working on an 820-3330 board that has green light, but no power. No liquid involved. Using genuine 85W charger.

- All main rails present (5v_s5, 3v3_s5, ppbus, 3v42)
- Nothing gets warm, no shorts detected.
- PPVRTC_G3H present
- PM_DSW_PWRGD present
- PM_SLP_SUS_L present, but PP5v_SUS and PP3v3_SUS both missing.

- Q7820: my gate (pin 3) is 3.3v, and my source (pin 4) is 3.34v, but my drain (pin 1) is 0v.
- Q7840: my gate (pin 3) is 4.92v, and my source (pin 4) is 5.02v, but my drain (pin 1) is 0v.

Are these two MOSFETs bad? My gate is lower than the source on both, but the drain on each is 0v. If I'm on the wrong track, please just let me know. Since I've got PM_SLP_SUS_L, but not PM_SLP_S5_L, and I'm missing 5v_sus/3v3_sus, I'd assume this is where my issue is.

Any help appreciated!

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: VCORE isn't brought up until much later in the power-on sequence. I'm not even getting into S4 yet. :)

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: Sorry [USER="515"]SMMRepair[/USER] Was half asleep and didn't drink any coffee yet when I made that comment. It is very possible that those fets are bad.. However, Something killed them. Bad controller most likely and the controller most likely took out all the fets in that circuit as well. Replace the TPS51980 and replace the FETs in that circuit and see if it fixes it.

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message:
No you don't just replace the 51980 and pray that fixes it. Diagnose FFS!!

SMC_ADAPTER_EN present?

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: Hey Duke, thanks. Yes, SMC_ADAPTER_EN is present and steady.

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] Isn't it true that If the 51980 fails it can screw up the 3.3v and 5v FETS?

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message:
yes its true, however since OP has 3v3_s5, U7201 probably isn't an issue just yet.

Since PM_SLP_SUS_L is present, have you checked if this translates into P5VSUS_EN ? If not whats SMC_BATLOW_L ?

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: BATLOW_L is probably not present. Does this board charge a battery? Does it power on from a charged battery?

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: Hey Duke, the board does not power from a charged battery, and it does not charge the battery. SMC_BATLOW_L is missing, yes.

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: SMC should be sending out SMC_BATLOW_L. Check Pull up R5040.

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: R5040 measuring out fine; 3.3v on pin 1, 0v on pin 2. Thinking this might be a bad SMC at this point?

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: Hey Duke, yeah PPBUS is solid at 12.58v.

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: OK, so I have an update: I replaced the SMC, and I now have pp3v3_sus and pp5v_sus, as well as SMC_BATLOW_L (3.3v). I still have no fan spin, but my PCH does get warm (not hot), so I think I'm now missing another s0 rail (or my PCH is bad), but I'll do some more digging and update the thread in a bit.

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: OK, I'm stuck at a point again. Not having a proper block-diagram with progressions/orders of rails makes it very tough. I have 3v3_sus and 5v_sus, but no PM_SLP_S5_L. I'm either missing something after 3v3/5v_sus but before pm_slp_s5_l, or my PCH is bad. The PCH gets slightly warm when the board is powered, which makes me think it's getting told to turn on, but nothing after that. I'm not sure how to confirm this, however. Any ideas on what I should check next? Thanks again.

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: If pch is getting warm without slp s5 i do suspect a bad pch too

title: 820-3330 Green Light, No Power
message: OK, thanks, duke! Identifying a failed PCH is just as helpful in learning as fixing the board. I'll send this one off to my more-skilled partner to get the PCH replaced. Thanks, Duke!
